forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 48. North northeast wind 2 to 6 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 68, with temperatures falling to around 65 in the afternoon. Northeast wind around 6 mph.

weather_report:
As the sun retreats beneath the horizon, Downtown San Francisco embarks upon a night of serene clarity, with the chill of near-48 degrees hanging gently in the air. A North northeast breeze whispers through the streets, barely stirring, promising a gentle embrace for the evening. The night sky, crisp and mostly clear, provides a perfect canvas for stargazers and contemplators alike. Tomorrow dawns with a sun that rises on a predominantly sunny canvas, inviting warmth that will cradle the city to a high of approximately 68 degrees, falling softly into the embrace of the afternoon at 65.

The lack of fog and the absence of the marine layer suggest a moment of purity, ideal for quiet strolls along the waterfront or leisurely gatherings in open spaces. As you prepare for the day, layering light, breathable fabrics beneath a warm jacket will prove wise—an acknowledgment of the day’s pleasantness and that ever-reluctant evening chill. With the day unfolding so invitingly, perhaps a visit to a local café for a warm beverage or an afternoon saunter through one of the city’s verdant parks would elevate the spirit, allowing one to relish in the tranquility that only a clear day can inspire.
